name: Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited
description: Driving growth in Zambia's poultry industry for over 60 years. At Hybrid Poultry Farm, we've achieved complete Farm-to-Farm traceability and empowered countless farmers through our out-grower program. With farms and hatcheries across Zambia, we deliver high-quality chicken products and day-old chicks.

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
We are thrilled to announce we're bringing the African Poultry Multiplication Initiative to Zambia!

In partnership with Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited , we will support expanded roll out and support for dual-purpose poultry (DPP) in rural regions of Zambia. In our first training workshop conducted last week, we trained 15 Hybrid Staff, including 7 Field Service Representitives (FSRs). In this training, we introduced the APMI model, emphasized crucial topics for rearing poultry in rural settings, delved into the role of DPP in promoting gender equity and family nutrition, and addressed aspects such as data collection, marketing, and recruitment.

We're looking forward to this partnership in Zambia, marking a significant step in supporting the expansion of DPP to more rural regions in Zambia.

Learn more about APMI: https://lnkd.in/dW8qigms

company_updates_collection.description: Three of our Small Scale Producers from Chipembe with their Zambro teen birds raised by Brooder Unit farmer Simon Lukhelo! As part of our Zambro Project under World Poultry Foundation we engaged a cooperative in Chipembe who were involved in a GIZ Empowerment project. We encouraged them to purchase 500 Zambro day-old chicks and raise them for four weeks under the Zambro Project after which they sold them to the Small Scale Producers. Dual-pupose poultry is making an impact in the villages of the Eastern Province and improving the lives of the communities. #zambro #dualpurposepoultry #sustainablefoodsystems

We are excited about this partnership with World Poultry Foundation bringing Hybrid Zambro, dual purpose poultry to the communities of Nyimba. We are honored to be a part of sustainable food solutions and nutrition. #Zambro #poultry
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description: In late 2023, we had the privilege of joining Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited on field visits to Nyimba District in Zambia's Eastern Province. Engaging with sales agents, farmers, and cooperatives, we introduced the concept of dual-purpose poultry, sparking enthusiasm and anticipation within the community for the arrival of these birds in Eastern Province.

Our Zambro Field Representatives were at the Nc'wala traditional ceremony in Chipata to promote the Zambro Project and sensitise people on the benefits of rearing Zambro for meat and eggs. This new improved village chicken is a sustainable food solution that will also provide opportunities for women to earn an extra income. #Zambro

It's wonderful to see the success of the AMPI Project with World Poultry Foundation in the Eastern Province, particularly the positive impact it is having on both poultry farming and community nutrition. The collaboration between Hybrid Poultry Farm and the brooder unit farmers seems to be yielding significant results, especially in areas like Lupala Cooperative in Vizimumba ward, Mchimadzi, Riverside, Chipembe, and Samora 2.

The focus on raising Zambro chickens from day one to week four and then selling them to small-scale producers for meat and egg production demonstrates a sustainable and economically viable approach to poultry farming. Additionally, the emphasis on empowering women in poultry production is commendable, as it contributes to gender equality and economic empowerment within the community.

Moreover, promoting the consumption of Zambro meat and eggs underscores the importance of adopting nutritious dietary behaviors. By encouraging healthier eating habits, the project not only improves the livelihoods of local farmers but also enhances the overall health and well-being of the community.

Overall, initiatives like the AMPI Project highlight the potential for agriculture to drive positive social and economic change, while also addressing nutritional challenges within communities.

Hybrid Poultry Farm is delighted to be working with World Poultry Foundation on the APMI program with out dual purpose poultry bird Zambro. Find out more about how the programme works by clicking the link to the blog below. #dualpurposepoultry #sustainablefoodsystems

Our latest blog delves into the interconnected roles of our on-the-ground players in the APMI program. Each individual forms a vital link to ensure the success of the entire initiative. Learn more about the ground-level dynamics here: https://lnkd.in/dHTrcJCi

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
‪We are so excited to introduce Mr. Willie Phiri, the African Poultry Multiplication Initiative (APMI) Manager at Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited Zambia stationed in Nyimba District, Eastern Province.

Reflecting on his extensive experience in the agricultural sector, Mr. Phiri expressed optimism about the APMI model, stating, "This model stands out as it provides crucial technical support to farmers through field staff representatives (FSRs), a key element lacking in previous models I've worked with."

Highlighting the APMI business model, Mr. Phiri emphasized its potential success, attributing it to the vaccination of chickens from a reliable source like Hybrid. He noted, "With clients investing their own money, there's a strong motivation for success; no farmer wants to lose their investment. These farmers understand how to generate profits."

We can't wait to see the progress in Zambia's Eastern Province under Mr. Phiri's leadership.

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description: Empowering Sales Leaders for Success ? Grateful for the impactful Sales Leadership Training held in Banjul, Gambia, from March 5th to 8th. Kudos to the World Poultry Foundation for organizing this for our valued partners: Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited (Zambia), Leecon Poultry (Sierra Leone), Feed De Nation (Sierra Leone), and G-farms Limited (Gambia). Special thanks to Nick Kingesley-Johnson from the Whitten & Roy Partnership for the insightful and transformative training. Our partners, engaged in Dual-Purpose Poultry (DPP) production and distribution, are now equipped for even greater success. Huge appreciation to WPF for championing poultry excellence worldwide. ? #SalesLeadership #PoultryExcellence #GlobalPartnerships

In partnership with Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited , we will support expanded roll out and support for dual-purpose poultry (DPP) in rural regions of Zambia. In our first training workshop conducted last week, we trained 15 Hybrid Staff, including 7 Field Service Representitives (FSRs). In this training, we introduced the APMI model, emphasized crucial topics for rearing poultry in rural settings, delved into the role of DPP in promoting gender equity and family nutrition, and addressed aspects such as data collection, marketing, and recruitment.

We're looking forward to this partnership in Zambia, marking a significant step in supporting the expansion of DPP to more rural regions in Zambia.

Learn more about APMI: https://lnkd.in/dW8qigms

company_updates_collection.description:
This Morning we held the official launch of the African Poultry Multiplication Initiative, in partnership with World Poultry Foundation. Hybrid is bringing improved village chicken known as Zambro to the Eastern Province through a pilot project in Rufunsa, Nyimba and Petauke. 

The aim is to ensure that the rural communities are able to grow for profit by buying and rearing Zambro for meat and eggs, as well as selling them. Zambro offers high nutritional value in protein which will also enrich the lives of rural communities.

We would like to extend a special thank you to the Minister of Livestock and Fisheries, Mr. Makozo Chikote, and the Minister of Water and Sanitation, Mr. Mike Mposha for their support with the initiative and at today's launch. 

For more information on APMI click the shared post from our partners.
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
We are excited to share that our APMI partnership with Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited in Zambia is now officially launched. 

This pilot project is currently serving Rufunsa, Nyimba, and Petauke and is poised for growth as we support the expansion of dual-purpose poultry in Zambia. A special thank you to the Minister of Livestock and Fishieries, Mr. Makozo Chikote, and the Minister of Water and Sanitation, Mr. Mike Mposha, for attending today's launch and supporting this exciting new initiative. Stay tuned for updates and achievements in the upcoming months.

Learn more about the impact dual-purpose poultry can have on development and nutritional goals:  https://lnkd.in/eJdG4c3N

company_updates_collection.description: Proud to be a part of the World Poultry Foundation African Poultry Multiplication Initiative that is changing the lives of people living in rural communities. In Zambia we are seeing the impact of promoting Zambro as a source of nutrition and income generation. We look forward to continuing this work.

company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description: Empowering Sales Leaders for Success ? Grateful for the impactful Sales Leadership Training held in Banjul, Gambia, from March 5th to 8th. Kudos to the World Poultry Foundation for organizing this for our valued partners: Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited (Zambia), Leecon Poultry (Sierra Leone), Feed De Nation (Sierra Leone), and G-farms Limited (Gambia). Special thanks to Nick Kingesley-Johnson from the Whitten & Roy Partnership for the insightful and transformative training. Our partners, engaged in Dual-Purpose Poultry (DPP) production and distribution, are now equipped for even greater success. Huge appreciation to WPF for championing poultry excellence worldwide. ? #SalesLeadership #PoultryExcellence #GlobalPartnerships

company_updates_collection.description:
It's wonderful to see the success of the AMPI Project with World Poultry Foundation in the Eastern Province, particularly the positive impact it is having on both poultry farming and community nutrition. The collaboration between Hybrid Poultry Farm and the brooder unit farmers seems to be yielding significant results, especially in areas like Lupala Cooperative in Vizimumba ward, Mchimadzi, Riverside, Chipembe, and Samora 2.

The focus on raising Zambro chickens from day one to week four and then selling them to small-scale producers for meat and egg production demonstrates a sustainable and economically viable approach to poultry farming. Additionally, the emphasis on empowering women in poultry production is commendable, as it contributes to gender equality and economic empowerment within the community.

Moreover, promoting the consumption of Zambro meat and eggs underscores the importance of adopting nutritious dietary behaviors. By encouraging healthier eating habits, the project not only improves the livelihoods of local farmers but also enhances the overall health and well-being of the community.

Overall, initiatives like the AMPI Project highlight the potential for agriculture to drive positive social and economic change, while also addressing nutritional challenges within communities.

Our Zambro Field Representatives were at the Nc'wala traditional ceremony in Chipata to promote the Zambro Project and sensitise people on the benefits of rearing Zambro for meat and eggs. This new improved village chicken is a sustainable food solution that will also provide opportunities for women to earn an extra income. #Zambro

Expanding access to dual-purpose poultry in Zambia is an exciting new opportunity for us at the World Poultry Foundation. We have been working hard with Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited to ensure farmers, Brooder Units, and Field Service Representatives are set up and trained for success.
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description: Three of our Small Scale Producers from Chipembe with their Zambro teen birds raised by Brooder Unit farmer Simon Lukhelo! As part of our Zambro Project under World Poultry Foundation we engaged a cooperative in Chipembe who were involved in a GIZ Empowerment project. We encouraged them to purchase 500 Zambro day-old chicks and raise them for four weeks under the Zambro Project after which they sold them to the Small Scale Producers. Dual-pupose poultry is making an impact in the villages of the Eastern Province and improving the lives of the communities. #zambro #dualpurposepoultry #sustainablefoodsystems

company_updates_collection.description: The World Poultry Foundation APMI- Zambro project team handed over a Hybrid branded scale and 510 Zambro chicks to Sharon Muchiya our largest Brooder Unit farmerin Rufunsa. We look forward to her supplying the Small Scale Producers with dual-purpose poultry and allowing them to grow for profit as well as use the birds for meat and eggs. #hybridpoultryfarm #zambro #growforprofit

We are excited to be working with Mr Willie Phiri under the African Poultry Multiplication Initiative to bring Hybrid Zambro-dual purpose poultry to the Eastern Province as a sustainable food solution.
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
‪We are so excited to introduce Mr. Willie Phiri, the African Poultry Multiplication Initiative (APMI) Manager at Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited Zambia stationed in Nyimba District, Eastern Province.

Reflecting on his extensive experience in the agricultural sector, Mr. Phiri expressed optimism about the APMI model, stating, "This model stands out as it provides crucial technical support to farmers through field staff representatives (FSRs), a key element lacking in previous models I've worked with."

Highlighting the APMI business model, Mr. Phiri emphasized its potential success, attributing it to the vaccination of chickens from a reliable source like Hybrid. He noted, "With clients investing their own money, there's a strong motivation for success; no farmer wants to lose their investment. These farmers understand how to generate profits."

We can't wait to see the progress in Zambia's Eastern Province under Mr. Phiri's leadership.

company_updates_collection.description: Three of our Small Scale Producers from Chipembe with their Zambro teen birds raised by Brooder Unit farmer Simon Lukhelo! As part of our Zambro Project under World Poultry Foundation we engaged a cooperative in Chipembe who were involved in a GIZ Empowerment project. We encouraged them to purchase 500 Zambro day-old chicks and raise them for four weeks under the Zambro Project after which they sold them to the Small Scale Producers. Dual-pupose poultry is making an impact in the villages of the Eastern Province and improving the lives of the communities. #zambro #dualpurposepoultry #sustainablefoodsystems

The Hybrid Zambro- Village Chicken Project in partnership with World Poultry Foundation aims to revitalize the poultry supply chain, ensuring a steady and sustainable market. Through it's pilot project in Eastern Province, Hybrid Poultry Farm is committed to empowering women and youth by providing them with an alternative source of income and improving nutrition. The Zambro project signifies a step towards economic empowerment and food security for rural populations.

Hybrid would like to wish all farmers a Happy World Poultry Day, poultry plays a crucial role in food security as a nutrient rich source of vitamins and an affordable protein. On this day we wish to highlight how Hybrid Broiler, Hybrid Layer and Hybrid Zambro have played a part in generating income for farmers, as well as providing quality meat and nutritious eggs for consumption. We promise to continue to enable shared prosperity through sustainable food production. #worldpoultryday24

A throwback to the 2024 Veterinary Association of Zambia AGM, where Hybrid Poultry Farm was awarded for its continued commitment to student training. We received the VAZ Chairpersons Award, recognizing Hybrid as a company supporting student training. At Hybrid, we strive to enable shared prosperity through sustainable food production by empowering students with the skills and training needed to bolster our agricultural sector and contribute to food security and economic development. #growforprofit #sustainablefoodproduction

It's exciting to witness the enthusiasm and commitment emerging from Zambia towards the new dual-purpose birds and APMI initiatives. The government's commitment to supporting initiatives like these further strengthens the future of poultry farming in Zambia.  

We look forward to showcasing the progress and achievements from our pilot project in the Eastern province with Hybrid. 

Learn more about dual-purpose birds here: https://lnkd.in/eJdG4c3N

feed and water intake, enhance the condition of the bird and minimize stress."- Read the full article from the July 2024 issue with AGRICOOP NEWSPAPER here: https://lnkd.in/dsMy7YUm

Hybrid Poultry Farm Corporate Social Responsibility Initiative

Donation to Kamaila School:

Hybrid Poultry Farm has demonstrated its commitment to corporate social responsibility through a generous donation to Kamaila School. The company provided:

- 20 window frames (150cm x 100cm)
- 4 door frames (90cm x 200cm)

These materials will be used to expand and complete the Secondary class block, benefiting over eighty pupils currently in grade 10. The head teacher of Kamaila School expressed gratitude on behalf of the institution, highlighting that this contribution will significantly enhance the quality of education for the students. 

Hybrid Poultry Farm's support will directly impact the learning environment, allowing the school to better serve its growing student population. This act of kindness reflects the company's dedication to supporting education and the local community. #csr

We are thankful for our partners National Milling Corporation Limited, thanks to our joint efforts we were able to engage with over 100 poultry farmers. The knowledge shared will ensure that our Zambian farmers are able to grow for profit and use poultry farming as a sustainable means of income. #growforprofit #sustainablefoodproduction

Lusaka, Zambia – Tuesday 23rd July 2024

Hybrid Poultry Farm and Lusaka 365 Express Gratitude for Community Support

Hybrid Poultry Farm and Lusaka 365 would like to extend their heartfelt thanks to the citizens of Lusaka for their remarkable show of support in knitting a winter scarf for the chicken statue at the Hybrid Roundabout. This unique community initiative brought warmth not only to the statue but also to our hearts.

In addition to this creative endeavour, various members of the public generously donated funds to Chisomo Centers, an esteemed organization dedicated to providing shelter, food, clothing, and personal care to vulnerable children in Lusaka.

Thanks to your kindness and generosity, Lusaka 365 and Hybrid Poultry Farm successfully raised K5,000 for Chisomo Centers. These funds will significantly aid in the organization's efforts to support and care for the children in need. 
We are deeply grateful for the community's involvement and support in making this initiative a success. Together, we have shown that through unity and compassion, we can make a positive difference in our community.

Thank you, Lusaka!

"In the future, the African egg industry has to face tremendous growth due to the expansion of the population and the demand for high-quality, reasonably priced sources of protein. It is expected that in Africa by 2040, the population will rise above 2 billion people. As incomes grow, as well as the awareness of the protein benefits, consumption will likely increase manyfold across the continent. Per capita egg consumption in Africa today is less than one egg per week, whereas the average consumption globally stands at 3-4 eggs a week. A mere nominal increase of 2.6 more eggs a year per person would double the per capita egg consumption by 2040."

The Hybrid Zambro- Village Chicken Project in partnership with World Poultry Foundation aims to revitalize the poultry supply chain, ensuring a steady and sustainable market. Through it's pilot project in Eastern Province, Hybrid Poultry Farm is committed to empowering women and youth by providing them with an alternative source of income and improving nutrition. The Zambro project signifies a step towards economic empowerment and food security for rural populations.

At Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited, we are proud to be a part of the African Poultry Multiplication Initiative (APMI) program, spearheaded by World Poultry Foundation (WPF). APMI’s unique market-systems development approach aims to create lasting, sustainable impact by ensuring everyone in the poultry value chain benefits — from small-scale farmers to businesses like ours. Together with WPF, we are building a resilient and inclusive poultry sector that uplifts and sustains small-scale farmers.
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
The APMI program is designed using a market-systems development approach to ensure that WPF's initiatives continue to thrive beyond donor funding. This approach requires that everyone in the value chain benefits, creating a sustainable and lasting impact. Recent sales numbers from Zambia partner, Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited, are a positive indicator that the program is on track, showing the kind of success needed for long-term integration into Hybrid's business model, benefiting small-scale partners for years to come. 

Hybrid reports, “Zambro day old chicks’ sales have improved in the region (Eastern Province) year on year by over 1,000% from January to July 2024 compared to the previous year. This is a huge achievement with a contribution of 25% to overall Zambro sales countrywide.”

Read more about our sustainablity mode here: 
https://lnkd.in/efbp6NzU

At Hybrid Poultry Farm, giving back is at the heart of who we are. For over 63 years, our commitment to Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) has allowed us to partner with organizations that uplift communities in need.

Kasisi Orphanage and Cheshire Homes are among the institutions we proudly support with weekly egg donations. Eggs provide essential nutrition, especially for growing children, and we’re humbled to see the positive impact this has on their well-being.

Recently, our CSR team visited both locations to engage with the children and gather valuable feedback on how our contributions have helped. We also had meaningful conversations to explore additional ways we can better serve their needs.

We remain dedicated to making a difference, one egg at a time. #CorporateSocialResponsibility #HybridPoultryFarm #MakingADifference #CommunitySupport

Today we take look back at The Poultry Farmer magazine issue 109 2024.The magazine featured one of our adverts and an article on Summer Brooding and Rearing. 

"Brooding is arguably the most critical stage in a chick's life, particularly during the first 14 days after hatching. This period demands meticulous attention to detail, especially in the summer when temperatures can soar to extreme levels. In Zambia, for example, summer temperatures can reach as high as 40 degrees Celsius, making it essential for farmers to closely monitor their chicks’ behaviour to prevent heat stress. Panting, a clear sign of overheating, should be observed as it indicates that the environmental temperature is too high for the chicks’ comfort and safety." #poultryfarming #poutrytips

Hybrid Poultry Farm’s Field Service Representatives recently teamed up with Tokozile N. Ngwenya, the Monitoring, Evaluation, and Learning Coordinator from the World Poultry Foundation, and Mr. Kaweche Phiri from FarmFeed to visit Rufunsa District in Lusaka Province. The goal: to review the ongoing progress of the Zambro Project—a collaborative effort between Hybrid Poultry Farm and the World Poultry Foundation.

During the visit, our Field Service Representative, Elisha, and Tokozile visited Mr. Amos Gasti’s farm and spoke with his poultry attendant, Farai, to assess the growth of his current flock. Mr. Gasti, who registered as a brooder unit farmer in December 2023, has successfully completed five cycles of brooder farming. His journey began with an initial order of 200 Zambro day-old chicks, which gradually increased to 250, 400, and then 1,000. In his current cycle, he is raising 600 birds, now 28 days old. 

With his farm conveniently located near the main market, Mr. Gasti has access to a ready market, where he sells his birds for 140-150 kwacha each. 

#GrowForProfit #Zambro

APMI’s unique market-systems development approach aims to create lasting, sustainable impact by ensuring everyone in the poultry value chain benefits — from small-scale farmers to businesses like ours. Together with WPF, we are building a resilient and inclusive poultry sector that uplifts and sustains small-scale farmers.

A Visit to Ferme Tambo: Building Poultry Dreams in Lubumbashi 

Just 45 km from the bustling town of Lubumbashi, we visited Ferme Tambo, a farm with big dreams and plenty of potential. With 12 poultry houses on-site and a vision to reach full capacity, the farm is gearing up to transform its poultry production.

 Our Technical Support team member Martin made the following observations:

•	Management: Batch 1 started with 2,040 chicks, after assessing the flock in the first week, we advised scaling back to the observed capacity of 1,500 for better management.
•	Feeders: Immediate action is needed to reduce feed spillage—new feeders will make a huge difference!
•	Ventilation: Proper airflow is key for healthy growth and disease prevention. 
•	Biosecurity: With different age groups on the farm, strict biosecurity measures are critical to keeping diseases at bay.

The farmer was delighted with our insights and is now ready to place another 2,000 chicks! At Hybrid, we’re here to support farmers like Mr. Tambo at every step--helping them grow for profit!

Here’s to building poultry success, one farm at a time! #HybridPoultryFarm #GrowForProfit #TechnicalSupport #PoultryFarming #Biosecurity #Lubumbashi

At Hybrid we are ending 2024 with gratitude and looking ahead to a prosperous 2025! As we close the chapter on 2024 and step into 2025, we at Hybrid Poultry Farm extend our heartfelt thanks to YOU—our farmers, partners, and community.

For 63 years, we’ve proudly supported your farms with the best quality, pre-vaccinated day-old chicks, designed to give your flocks the strongest start possible. Our commitment doesn’t end there. With our dedicated technical support team, we’re here to guide you every step of the way, from day one until your birds are ready for market. 

? From our farm to yours, we promise to:
 Lead in sustainability—Poultry farming supports food security by providing affordable, high-quality protein to communities.
 Drive profitability—Empowering farmers to grow and succeed.
 Deliver unmatched quality—Continuing our legacy of excellence.

Here’s to another year of partnership, growth, and success! Wishing you a prosperous and fulfilling 2025. #HybridPoultryFarm #63YearsOfExcellence #GrowForProfit #SustainabilityInFarming

Giving Back at Christmas: Empowering Zambro Farmers

Christmas is a season of giving, and this year, the spirit of generosity came alive through our visits to Zambro farmers in various villages. As a token of appreciation for their dedication and hard work, we gifted them vibrant chitenges, a gesture that brought smiles and a sense of pride to the women who continue to make remarkable strides in poultry farming.

Madam Tembo of Chintili Village:
 Madam Tembo received her chitenge with gratitude, symbolizing her contributions to her community. Her journey as a Zambro farmer is inspiring, showcasing how poultry farming uplifts lives and strengthens livelihoods.

Madam Njhovu of Chintili Village:
 Currently managing 50 full-grown chickens (3 months old), Madam Njhovu is a shining example of sustainable entrepreneurship. Selling her chickens at ZMW 120 each, she plans to reinvest her earnings by ordering 100 more, ensuring the growth of her poultry business.

Madam Edina Lumangwa of Chishota Village:
 Madam Lumangwa’s dedication is reflected in her three thriving batches of chickens. Her first batch of 10 chickens, now 4 months old, provides eggs for both home consumption and sale. Her second batch of 100 birds, currently 2 months old, is being sold to fund another 100 chicks, demonstrating her commitment to expanding her venture.

Mrs. Nyendwa of Nyautaye Village:
 A dedicated Zambro farmer, Mrs. Nyendwa has made remarkable progress in poultry farming. With 200 teen birds and a second batch of 100 chicks (now 2 months old), she is investing in her future. Part of her earnings have already been used to book another 100 chicks, and she is preparing to stock more birds to support her egg business at her shop.

These visits were a celebration of the resilience, determination, and entrepreneurial spirit of Zambro farmers. By supporting them through small gestures like gifting chitenges, we not only honour their hard work but also strengthen their resolve to grow and sustain their businesses.

At Hybrid Poultry Farm, giving back is at the heart of who we are. For over 63 years, our commitment to Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) has allowed us to partner with organizations that uplift communities in need.

Kasisi Orphanage and Cheshire Homes are among the institutions we proudly support with weekly egg donations. Eggs provide essential nutrition, especially for growing children, and we’re humbled to see the positive impact this has on their well-being.

Recently, our CSR team visited both locations to engage with the children and gather valuable feedback on how our contributions have helped. We also had meaningful conversations to explore additional ways we can better serve their needs.

We remain dedicated to making a difference, one egg at a time. #CorporateSocialResponsibility #HybridPoultryFarm #MakingADifference #CommunitySupport

At Hybrid, we’re not just about poultry farming—we’re about building sustainable futures and empowering rural women to thrive. The Kachenja Women’s Group "Washala Washala!" in Mtilizi is leading the way!

This incredible group of 24 women, including 7 who recently purchased 27 teen birds, is transforming their lives through Zambro farming. Their dedication as Brooder Unit farmers has been nothing short of inspiring.
To honor their hard work and commitment, we gifted the group Hybrid chitenges—a small token to recognize their incredible contributions to sustainable farming and their community.

Here’s to empowering women, creating brighter futures, and soaring higher together. #HybridPoultry #Zambro #EmpoweringWomen #SustainableFarming #WashalaWashala #Mtilizi

Meet Martha Phiri, an inspiring Hybrid Zambro brooder unit farmer from Petauke! By day, Martha is a dedicated teacher, but her passion for farming shines through as she raises Zambro chicks for four weeks before selling them to small-scale producers. These producers continue the journey, rearing the chicks for both meat and eggs.

Through the Zambro Project, part of the African Poultry Multiplication Initiative by the World Poultry Foundation, Martha has unlocked a new level of financial independence. Today, she not only supports her extended family but also ensures her children have everything they need for school.

Hybrid Poultry Farm is proud to collaborate with World Poultry Foundation on an insightful article highlighting The Vital Role of Field Service Representatives (FSRs) in Marketing for the African Poultry Multiplication Initiative (APMI).

The APMI is transforming the poultry value chain by enabling rural farmers and agribusinesses to access high-quality poultry inputs, adopt sustainable practices, and benefit from capacity-building initiatives.

At the core of this success are Field Service Representatives—dedicated professionals who bridge the gap between private-sector partners and rural communities. Their role extends beyond providing technical support; they are key drivers of marketing efforts that introduce dual-purpose poultry (DPP) birds to new regions.

FSRs play a critical role in, building trust within local communities, raising awareness about the benefits of DPP birds and supporting the adoption of innovative poultry solutions.This partnership underscores our commitment to empowering farmers, strengthening the poultry industry, and creating lasting change across Zambia.
Read the full article here: https://shorturl.at/keK1f
 Let's continue building a resilient future for poultry farming—together.
#PoultryFarming #Agribusiness #Partnerships #APMI #HybridPoultryFarm #WorldPoultryFoundation

We’re celebrating the incredible achievements of the African Poultry Multiplication Initiative (APMI) in Zambia! Over the last two years, in partnership with Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited in Eastern Zambia, we’ve worked to develop a profitable poultry chain to improve access to high-quality Dual-Purpose Poultry (DPP) for smallholder farmers in Eastern Province, transforming lives through better nutrition and economic opportunities.  

A huge thank you to Hybrid Poultry and their incredible team for making this program possible. Here’s to building a stronger future for Zambia’s poultry sector! We can't wait to see how this program grows even after funding has ended in Zambia.

We’re honored to have received an award from the World Poultry Foundation (WPF) in recognition of our efforts to transform Zambia’s rural poultry sector through the African Poultry Multiplication Initiative (APMI), established in 2023.

It was also our pleasure to host WPF’s Randall Ennis (CEO), Jan de Jonge (Senior Program Director for Africa), and Maureen Stickel (Director of International Program Development), along with WPF board members, for a field visit. Together, we explored the inspiring work of three Zambro brooder unit farmers and witnessed a live marketing meeting with small-scale producers in Rufunsa.

This recognition fuels our commitment to empowering rural communities and advancing sustainable poultry farming practices. #HybridPoultryFarm #WorldPoultryFoundation #Zambro #DualPurposePoultry #SustainableFarming

Investing in our people is investing in the future of Zambian poultry! Hybrid Poultry Farm is committed to the success of the Zambro Project under the African Poultry Multiplication Initiative (APMI), and comprehensive training is paramount.

Our dedicated Field Service Representatives (FSRs) were trained in the best practices in poultry management, effective brooder unit recruitment strategies, impactful sales techniques, and accurate data collection methodologies.

We're also fostering peer-to-peer learning with experienced FSRs like Patrick Bwalya and Elisha Kasoka from Eastern Province sharing their invaluable field insights and mentoring the next generation of FSRs.
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
Field Service Representative training is underway in Muchinga Province, Zambia, as part of our expansion of the African Poultry Multiplication Initiative in Zambia

The World Poultry Foundation and Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited teams launched the training with a blend of classroom and hands-on instruction covering poultry management, brooder unit recruitment, sales techniques, and data collection.

Experienced FSRs Patrick Bwalya and Elisha Kasoka, from Eastern Province, are also participatin in the training to share best practices from the field and support the next generation of FSRs.

Learn more about the vital role FSRs play in the success of APMI: https://lnkd.in/diR-wVR2

This Heroes Day, we honor the courage that sparks every new beginning.

At Hybrid Poultry Farm, we celebrate the heroes who build, nurture, and grow, especially our hardworking farmers driving Zambia’s food security forward.

Happy Heroes Day!

#hybridpoultryfarm #heroesday2025

Vincent Musonda, The Egg Innovator of Petauke

Today, we had the incredible opportunity to visit Vincent Musonda, the visionary behind Mute Poultry Farm, nestled in Petauke's Hillside Compound. Vincent is a dedicated farmer who exemplifies what Zambro can achieve!
Vincent started with a robust flock of 680 Zambro birds. After managing his flock, he now has a strong base of 550 birds, with over 400 being females! He has decided to raise his Zambro’s for egg production and he plans to ensure he reaches his target number of laying hens.

Mr. Musonda shared his ambitious goal, to become the major producer of local eggs for his community! He is already on his way, consistently supplying fresh Zambro eggs to the community directly through his thriving Home Shop. Currently, he collects an average of 2.5 trays per week, and he's expecting these numbers to climb even higher in the coming days as his younger hens mature.

Vincent highlighted the support and technical assistance he receives from Hybrid Poultry Farm. It's stories like Vincent's that truly inspire us and affirm our mission to empower farmers and build sustainable livelihoods. #ZambroSuccess #FarmerSpotlight #Petauke #EggProduction #PoultryFarming #HybridPoultryFarm

Meet Madam Carol Mweetwa, a dedicated farmer from Petauke's Fairview Compound whose Zambro flock is consistently giving her returns.

Carol is currently raising 100 Zambro birds, now just 10 weeks old, and the results are outstanding! Her good poultry management paid off, with an impressive minimal mortality rate – losing only 2 chicks during the crucial first week of brooding. This speaks volumes about her management skills and the robustness of the Zambro breed!

 Her flock has already achieved an incredible average body weight of 2.5 kgs at 10 weeks, surpassing expectations! Carol has already secured a market for her entire flock in Lusaka! This pre-secured demand highlights the strong market appeal of Zambro birds for both meat and eggs.

Inspired by her success, Carol is now planning to place her next order for more Zambro chicks next week, ready to expand her flourishing poultry business. Her story is a testament to the profitability and efficiency Zambro brings to our farmers. #ZambroSuccess #FarmerSpotlight #Petauke #GrowthForProfit #HybridPoultryFarm

Today, we witnessed another significant transaction underlining the robust activity within Zambia's poultry value chain. A client from Lusaka acquired 50 one-month-old teen birds from Mrs. Muchiya, one of our dedicated brooder unit farmers in Chongwe.

Mrs. Muchiya, currently managing a flock of 1,000 birds, demonstrates consistent growth and efficiency. This recent sale marks her sixth cycle of Zambro teen birds, following a purchase of 500 chicks just last week. Her commitment to maintaining a continuous supply of quality dual purpose birds is inspiring.

It's truly wonderful to see such proactive poultry farming under the APMI project, ensuring a steady supply for consumers across the region. #Zambro #ChongweFarmers #HybridPoultryFarm #ValueChain #DualPurposeChicken

Yesterday in Tanzania, EW Nutrition had the privilege of being invited by Aviagen and APD - Africa Poultry Development Group to share expertise on "Trends, Risks & Preventive Strategies in Gut Health." Our Global Manager Gut Health, Madalina Diaconu presented key insights, fostering engaging conversations with the group of poultry professionals.

Participants from Kenchic Limited, Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited, and Tanbreeds, all part of the APD Group, engaged in a dynamic knowledge exchange on crucial topics, including Broiler and Brooding Principles, Breeder Flock Nutrition, Rearing Breeders from 0 to 24 Weeks, and Broiler Flock Nutrition. It was a great opportunity to connect, learn, and collaborate with poultry professionals dedicated to advancing the industry in Africa. Looking forward to more such impactful exchanges!

#PoultryHealth #GutHealth #AnimalNutrition #Poultry #Tanzania #PoultryIndustry #KnowledgeSharing
Special thank you to Musonda and Nkwazi for this passionate story about our beloved chicken!
company_updates_collection.reshared_post_description:
Mukolwe is a 10-foot chicken statue that has mastered the art of career pivoting like no executive before. He's been a marketing mascot, cultural ambassador, and even a ZAF graduate! The best part? He's done all this while remaining on the ground...in the same spot!

Mukolwe's ability to adapt, capitalise on community engagement, and build lasting brand equity should be taught in business programmes across the country. 

Find out more about this national icon here: https://lnkd.in/dA_U4mZ8

#Leadership #brandstrategy #communityengagement #marketing #Zambia #culturalmarketing

company_updates_collection.description:
Catherine Malupande is one of our passionate Zambro farmers from Rufunsa and her dedication to sustainable poultry farming is truly inspiring. Today, Catherine proudly sold 32 of her 2-month-old Zambro birds to Madam Ritah Phiri, each at K95! What's even more impressive? These birds averaged a fantastic 1.7kg each – showcasing the excellent growth potential of Zambro!

With the money from this sale, Catherine plans to reinvest and stock even more birds, continuing her journey of growth. She currently manages two flocks: one at 2 months and another at 24 days. Her business plan? To maintain a continuous chain flock of three different age groups – ensuring a steady supply and consistent income!

Madam Ritah Phiri, the small scale producer, is excited to raise these versatile Zambro birds for both eggs and meat, demonstrating the incredible dual-purpose advantage of the breed. #ZambroSuccess #RufunsaFarmers #HybridPoultryFarm #DualPurposeChicken

Hybrid Poultry Farm joins the nation in mourning the passing of former President Edgar Chagwa Lungu. We extend our deepest condolences to his beloved family, close friends, and the people of Zambia.

President Lungu served our country with dedication and played a significant role in shaping its path. As a statesman, his leadership and service will be remembered with gratitude and respect.

May his soul rest in eternal peace.

These donations were made possible through the incredible generosity of our employees during our Back to School Day earlier this year, a creative and impactful initiative where staff came dressed in school uniforms and contributed funds, with additional support from management.

At Hybrid, we believe in nurturing future generations and supporting the communities we serve.

Here’s to raising a literate community, one child at a time.

#Hybridpoultryfarm

On Unity Day, we stand in solidarity with the call for justice and reparations for Africans and people of African descent.

At Hybrid Poultry Farm, we remain committed to building a more equitable future. Through sustainable poultry production, we empower farmers and strengthen local food systems, laying the foundation for shared prosperity, justice, and opportunity for all.

From all of us at Hybrid Poultry Farm; Happy Unity Day!!

Breaking free. Rising strong. Growing together.

This Heroes Day, we honor the courage that sparks every new beginning.

At Hybrid Poultry Farm, we celebrate the heroes who build, nurture, and grow, especially our hardworking farmers driving Zambia’s food security forward.

Happy Heroes Day!

#hybridpoultryfarm #heroesday2025

Vincent Musonda, The Egg Innovator of Petauke

Today, we had the incredible opportunity to visit Vincent Musonda, the visionary behind Mute Poultry Farm, nestled in Petauke's Hillside Compound. Vincent is a dedicated farmer who exemplifies what Zambro can achieve!
Vincent started with a robust flock of 680 Zambro birds. After managing his flock, he now has a strong base of 550 birds, with over 400 being females! He has decided to raise his Zambro’s for egg production and he plans to ensure he reaches his target number of laying hens.

Mr. Musonda shared his ambitious goal, to become the major producer of local eggs for his community! He is already on his way, consistently supplying fresh Zambro eggs to the community directly through his thriving Home Shop. Currently, he collects an average of 2.5 trays per week, and he's expecting these numbers to climb even higher in the coming days as his younger hens mature.

Vincent highlighted the support and technical assistance he receives from Hybrid Poultry Farm. It's stories like Vincent's that truly inspire us and affirm our mission to empower farmers and build sustainable livelihoods. #ZambroSuccess #FarmerSpotlight #Petauke #EggProduction #PoultryFarming #HybridPoultryFarm

Meet Madam Carol Mweetwa, a dedicated farmer from Petauke's Fairview Compound whose Zambro flock is consistently giving her returns.

Carol is currently raising 100 Zambro birds, now just 10 weeks old, and the results are outstanding! Her good poultry management paid off, with an impressive minimal mortality rate – losing only 2 chicks during the crucial first week of brooding. This speaks volumes about her management skills and the robustness of the Zambro breed!

 Her flock has already achieved an incredible average body weight of 2.5 kgs at 10 weeks, surpassing expectations! Carol has already secured a market for her entire flock in Lusaka! This pre-secured demand highlights the strong market appeal of Zambro birds for both meat and eggs.

Inspired by her success, Carol is now planning to place her next order for more Zambro chicks next week, ready to expand her flourishing poultry business. Her story is a testament to the profitability and efficiency Zambro brings to our farmers. #ZambroSuccess #FarmerSpotlight #Petauke #GrowthForProfit #HybridPoultryFarm

Today, we witnessed another significant transaction underlining the robust activity within Zambia's poultry value chain. A client from Lusaka acquired 50 one-month-old teen birds from Mrs. Muchiya, one of our dedicated brooder unit farmers in Chongwe.

Mrs. Muchiya, currently managing a flock of 1,000 birds, demonstrates consistent growth and efficiency. This recent sale marks her sixth cycle of Zambro teen birds, following a purchase of 500 chicks just last week. Her commitment to maintaining a continuous supply of quality dual purpose birds is inspiring.

It's truly wonderful to see such proactive poultry farming under the APMI project, ensuring a steady supply for consumers across the region. #Zambro #ChongweFarmers #HybridPoultryFarm #ValueChain #DualPurposeChicken

Yesterday in Tanzania, EW Nutrition had the privilege of being invited by Aviagen and APD - Africa Poultry Development Group to share expertise on "Trends, Risks & Preventive Strategies in Gut Health." Our Global Manager Gut Health, Madalina Diaconu presented key insights, fostering engaging conversations with the group of poultry professionals.

Participants from Kenchic Limited, Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited, and Tanbreeds, all part of the APD Group, engaged in a dynamic knowledge exchange on crucial topics, including Broiler and Brooding Principles, Breeder Flock Nutrition, Rearing Breeders from 0 to 24 Weeks, and Broiler Flock Nutrition. It was a great opportunity to connect, learn, and collaborate with poultry professionals dedicated to advancing the industry in Africa. Looking forward to more such impactful exchanges!

#PoultryHealth #GutHealth #AnimalNutrition #Poultry #Tanzania #PoultryIndustry #KnowledgeSharing

Proud to announce that the Hybrid Zambro, our hardy dual-purpose chicken, has been featured in The New York Times! 

This international spotlight highlights the transformative impact Zambro is making in rural Zambia, from improving food security and boosting incomes to empowering women and smallholder farmers.
It’s more than just a chicken; it’s a tool for progress.

A heartfelt thank you to our hardworking farmers, dedicated partners, and the teams at Hybrid Poultry Farm and the World Poultry Foundation for making this possible.
Proudly Zambian. Globally recognized.

#ZambroChicken #HybridPoultryFarm #AgricultureInnovation #FoodSecurity #SustainableFarming #Zambia

 Her flock has already achieved an incredible average body weight of 2.5 kgs at 10 weeks, surpassing expectations! Carol has already secured a market for her entire flock in Lusaka! This pre-secured demand highlights the strong market appeal of Zambro birds for both meat and eggs.

Inspired by her success, Carol is now planning to place her next order for more Zambro chicks next week, ready to expand her flourishing poultry business. Her story is a testament to the profitability and efficiency Zambro brings to our farmers. #ZambroSuccess #FarmerSpotlight #Petauke #GrowthForProfit #HybridPoultryFarm

Today, we witnessed another significant transaction underlining the robust activity within Zambia's poultry value chain. A client from Lusaka acquired 50 one-month-old teen birds from Mrs. Muchiya, one of our dedicated brooder unit farmers in Chongwe.

Mrs. Muchiya, currently managing a flock of 1,000 birds, demonstrates consistent growth and efficiency. This recent sale marks her sixth cycle of Zambro teen birds, following a purchase of 500 chicks just last week. Her commitment to maintaining a continuous supply of quality dual purpose birds is inspiring.

It's truly wonderful to see such proactive poultry farming under the APMI project, ensuring a steady supply for consumers across the region. #Zambro #ChongweFarmers #HybridPoultryFarm #ValueChain #DualPurposeChicken

Yesterday in Tanzania, EW Nutrition had the privilege of being invited by Aviagen and APD - Africa Poultry Development Group to share expertise on "Trends, Risks & Preventive Strategies in Gut Health." Our Global Manager Gut Health, Madalina Diaconu presented key insights, fostering engaging conversations with the group of poultry professionals.

Participants from Kenchic Limited, Hybrid Poultry Farm (Z) Limited, and Tanbreeds, all part of the APD Group, engaged in a dynamic knowledge exchange on crucial topics, including Broiler and Brooding Principles, Breeder Flock Nutrition, Rearing Breeders from 0 to 24 Weeks, and Broiler Flock Nutrition. It was a great opportunity to connect, learn, and collaborate with poultry professionals dedicated to advancing the industry in Africa. Looking forward to more such impactful exchanges!

#PoultryHealth #GutHealth #AnimalNutrition #Poultry #Tanzania #PoultryIndustry #KnowledgeSharing
Special thank you to Musonda and Nkwazi for this passionate story about our beloved chicken!
